newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Afghan Taleban take key town -report.
newsitem.headline: Afghan Taleban take key town -report.

text.p: Afghanistan's Taleban Islamic militia recaptured the strategic town of Jabal os-Siraj north of Kabul in a fresh offensive against its opponents early on Saturday, a Pakistan-based Afghan news service said.

The Afghan Islamic Press (AIP) said the purist militia launched the offensive with 2,000 fighters, tanks and jet bombers pushing the forces of opposition guerrilla commander Ahmad Shah Masood from the town on Kabul's main highway to the north after a four-hour battle.

AIP quoted a Taleban spokesman, Abdul Wakil, as saying the militia forces were now advancing towards the mouth of Masood's native Panjsher Valley and fighting for another strategic town, Golbahar, which they had lost recently to opposition.
There was no independent confirmation of this report.

Masood's forces had captured both Golbahar, at the entrance to the Panjsher Valley, and Jabal os-Siraj last week cutting off a Taleban force based in Pul-i-Khumri, north of the Hindu Kush mountain range, while the militia was also ousted from the newly taken main northern city of Mazar-i-Sharif.
